Uses of Class
generation.CardinalDirection

  • Packages that use CardinalDirection 
    Package Description
    generation  

    • Uses of CardinalDirection in generation

      Methods in generation that return CardinalDirection 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CardinalDirection Wall.getDirection()
      Provides the direction for the wall with regard to the internal position (x,y).
      static CardinalDirection CardinalDirection.getDirection(int dx, int dy)
      Gives the matching direction for (dx,dy) pair as in Cells.java
      CardinalDirection CardinalDirection.oppositeDirection()
      Gives the opposite direction which is the same as applying a 180 degree rotation.
      CardinalDirection CardinalDirection.randomDirection()
      Gives a random direction.
      CardinalDirection CardinalDirection.rotateClockwise()
      Gives the direction that results from a 90 degree clockwise rotation applied to the current direction.
      static CardinalDirection CardinalDirection.valueOf(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static CardinalDirection[] CardinalDirection.values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Methods in generation with parameters of type CardinalDirection 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Cells.hasNoWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)
      Tells if the given position has no wall in the given direction.
      boolean MazeContainer.hasWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)
      Tells if at position (x,y) and looking into given direction faces a wall.
      boolean MazeConfiguration.hasWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)
      Tells if one faces a wall at position (x,y) looking into the given direction.
      boolean Cells.hasWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)
      Tells if the given position has a wall in the given direction.
      java.util.Iterator<int[]> Cells.iterator(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd) 
      void Wall.setWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd)
      Sets the internal fields to the given values for a (x,y) position and direction
      Constructors in generation with parameters of type CardinalDirection 
      Constructor and Description
      Wall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd)
      Constructor, values have same effect has setWall(x,y,cd).
